page.title: 08Kirtlington Quarry
page.content: Kirtlington Quarry was the site of the old Oxford Portland Cement Company Limited cement works between 1907 and 1927 when the company moved to Shipton-on-Cherwell. It has been designated an area of scientific interest because of the Jurassic Limestone formation. People with permission go down the quarry to look for fossils. Because the quarry has not been worked for such a long time it is all over-grown. There is an open area, a wooded area and the canal which combine to make different natural habitats, providing a varied ecology. For permission to visit the quarry, apply to Blue Circle Industries PLC, Estates Department, Hilton, Derby DE6 5GE. Telephone Etwall (028373) 2844/5.
